trans-unit.source: 'Root-relative' URLs
(1) electron, worker and worklet comes combined with either node or browser, depending on the context.
(1) import and require are both set independent of referencing syntax. require has always lower priority.
(1) deprecated in Node.js, * should be preferred.
(2) "./" is intentionally ignored as key.
(2) This is set for browser target environment.
(3) The property value is ignored and property key is used as target. Effectively only allowing mappings with key and value are identical.
(4) The syntax is supported, but always the first entry is used, which makes it unusable for any practical use case.
(5) Fallback to alternative sibling parent conditions is handling incorrectly.
(6) For the require condition object order is handled incorrectly. This is intentionally as wmr doesn't differ between referencing syntax.

(7) When using "exports": "./file.js" abbreviation, any request e. g. package/not-existing will resolve to that. When not using the abbreviation, direct file access e. g. package/file.js will not lead to an error.

trans-unit.source: :information_source: Source maps and assets referenced with url: when style loader is used with { options: { sourceMap: true } } option, the CSS modules will be generated as Blobs, so relative paths don't work (they would be relative to chrome:blob or chrome:devtools). In order for assets to maintain correct paths setting output.publicPath property of webpack configuration must be set, so that absolute paths are generated. Alternatively you can enable the convertToAbsoluteUrls option mentioned above.
trans-unit.target: : information_source: mapas de origen y activos referenciados con url : cuando se usa el cargador de estilo con la { options: { sourceMap: true } } , los módulos CSS se generarán como Blob s, por lo que las rutas relativas no funcionan (serían relativas a chrome:blob o chrome:devtools ). Para que los activos mantengan las rutas correctas, se output.publicPath establecer la propiedad output.publicPath de la configuración del paquete web, de modo que se generen rutas absolutas. Alternativamente, puede habilitar la opción convertToAbsoluteUrls mencionada anteriormente.

WebWorkers are restricted by a same-origin policy, so if your webpack assets are not being served from the same origin as your application, their download may be blocked by your browser. This scenario can commonly occur if you are hosting your assets under a CDN domain. Even downloads from the webpack-dev-server could be blocked.

trans-unit.source: "." property
"default" condition

"eager": Generates no extra chunk. All modules are included in the current chunk and no additional network requests are made. A Promise is still returned but is already resolved. In contrast to a static import, the module isn't executed until the call to import() is made.
trans-unit.target: "eager" : no genera ningún fragmento adicional. Todos los módulos están incluidos en el bloque actual y no se realizan solicitudes de red adicionales. Aún se devuelve una Promise pero ya está resuelta. A diferencia de una importación estática, el módulo no se ejecuta hasta que se realiza la llamada a import() .

trans-unit.source: "empty": Provide an empty object.
trans-unit.target: "empty" : proporciona un objeto vacío.

trans-unit.source: "eval" has the best performance, but doesn't assist you for transpiled code.
trans-unit.target: "eval" tiene el mejor rendimiento, pero no le ayuda con el código transpilado.

trans-unit.source: "lazy" (default): Generates a lazy-loadable chunk for each import()ed module.
trans-unit.target: "lazy" (predeterminado): genera un fragmento de carga diferida para cada módulo import() ed.

trans-unit.source: "lazy-once": Generates a single lazy-loadable chunk that can satisfy all calls to import(). The chunk will be fetched on the first call to import(), and subsequent calls to import() will use the same network response. Note that this only makes sense in the case of a partially dynamic statement, e.g. import(`./locales/${language}.json`), where there are multiple module paths that could potentially be requested.
trans-unit.target: "lazy-once" : genera un solo fragmento de carga diferida que puede satisfacer todas las llamadas a import() . El fragmento se obtendrá en la primera llamada a import() y las llamadas posteriores a import() utilizarán la misma respuesta de red. Tenga en cuenta que esto solo tiene sentido en el caso de una declaración parcialmente dinámica, por ejemplo, import(`./locales/${language}.json`) , donde hay múltiples rutas de módulo que podrían ser solicitadas.

trans-unit.source: "mock": Provide a mock that implements the expected interface but has little or no functionality.
trans-unit.target: "mock" : proporciona un simulacro que implementa la interfaz esperada pero tiene poca o ninguna funcionalidad.

trans-unit.source: "mock": The fixed value "/".
trans-unit.target: "mock" : el valor fijo "/" .

trans-unit.source: "mock": The fixed value "index.js".
trans-unit.target: "mock" : el valor fijo "index.js" .

trans-unit.source: "module": Use with ES6 ready code.
trans-unit.target: "module" : Úselo con el código listo para ES6.

trans-unit.source: "text/javascript" (default)
trans-unit.target: "text/javascript" (predeterminado)

trans-unit.source: "weak": Tries to load the module if the module function has already been loaded in some other way (i. e. another chunk imported it or a script containing the module was loaded). A Promise is still returned but, only successfully resolves if the chunks are already on the client. If the module is not available, the Promise is rejected. A network request will never be performed. This is useful for universal rendering when required chunks are always manually served in initial requests (embedded within the page), but not in cases where app navigation will trigger an import not initially served.
trans-unit.target: "weak" : intenta cargar el módulo si la función del módulo ya se ha cargado de alguna otra manera (es decir, se importó otro fragmento o se cargó un script que contiene el módulo). Aún se devuelve una Promise , pero solo se resuelve correctamente si los fragmentos ya están en el cliente. Si el módulo no está disponible, la Promise se rechaza. Nunca se realizará una solicitud de red. Esto es útil para la representación universal cuando los fragmentos requeridos siempre se entregan manualmente en las solicitudes iniciales (incrustados dentro de la página), pero no en los casos en que la navegación de la aplicación activará una importación que no se entregó inicialmente.

trans-unit.source: <link> paths matching these conditions (see [Condition] in the webpack documentation) will not be changed when transformed into imports. This can be useful for respecting aliases, loader syntax (e.g. markup-inline-loader!./my-element.html), or module paths.
trans-unit.target: <link> rutas que coincidan con estas condiciones (ver [Condición] en la documentación del paquete web) no se cambiarán cuando se transformen en import s. Esto puede resultar útil para respetar los alias, la sintaxis del cargador (por ejemplo, markup-inline-loader!./my-element.html ) o rutas de módulos.

trans-unit.source: <link>s pointing to paths matching these conditions (see [Condition] in the webpack documentation) will not be transformed into imports.
trans-unit.target: <link> apunten a rutas que coincidan con estas condiciones (consulte [Condición] en la documentación del paquete web) no se transformarán en import s.

trans-unit.source: '...' can be used in optimization.minimizer to access the defaults.
'anonymous' - Enable cross-origin loading without credentials
'auto' - emit warnings in development mode and emit errors in production mode (default behavior)
'built' - whether the asset has been built;
'cacheable' - whether the item is cacheable;
'chunks' - what chunks the item originates from (for example, if there are multiple subchunks for one chunk - the subchunks will be grouped together according to their main chunk);

'eager': Generates no extra chunk. All modules are included in the current chunk and no additional network requests are made. A Promise is still returned but is already resolved. In contrast to a static import, the module isn't executed until the call to import() is made.
'error' - errors only
'errors' - amount of errors in items;
'failed' - whether the item has failed compilation;
'id' is the item's id;
'identifier' - identifier of the item;
'import' - uses import() to load a native EcmaScript module (async module)
'index' - item's processing index;
'info' - errors, warnings, and info messages
'issuer' - an identifier of the issuer;
'issuerId' - an id of the issuer;
'issuerName' - a name of the issuer;
'issuerPath' - a full issuer object. There's no real need to sort by this field;
'lazy' (default): Generates a lazy-loadable chunk for each import()ed module.

'lazy-once': Generates a single lazy-loadable chunk that can satisfy all calls to import(). The chunk will be fetched on the first call to import(), and subsequent calls to import() will use the same network response. Note that this only makes sense in the case of a partially dynamic statement, e.g. import(`./locales/${language}.json`), where multiple module paths that can potentially be requested.
'log' - errors, warnings, info messages, log messages, groups, clears. Collapsed groups are displayed in a collapsed state.
'log', true - errors, warnings, info messages, log messages, groups, clears. Collapsed groups are displayed in a collapsed state.
'mock': The fixed value '/'.
'mock': The fixed value '/index.js'.
'name' - a item's name that was assigned to it upon importing;
'none' - disable logging
'none', false - disable logging
'optional' - whether the asset is optional;
'pack': Store data when compiler is idle in a single file for all cached items
'prefetched' - whether the asset will be prefetched;
'promise' - same as 'var' but awaits the result (async module)
'script' - load script exposing predefined global variables with HTML <script> element
'size' - a size of item in bytes;
'use-credentials' - Enable cross-origin loading with credentials
'verbose' - log everything except debug and trace. Collapsed groups are displayed in expanded state.
'warn' - errors and warnings only
'warning' - emit warnings instead errors
'warnings' - amount of warnings in items;

'weak': Tries to load the module if the module function has already been loaded in some other way (e.g. another chunk imported it or a script containing the module was loaded). A Promise is still returned, but only successfully resolves if the chunks are already on the client. If the module is not available, the Promise is rejected. A network request will never be performed. This is useful for universal rendering when required chunks are always manually served in initial requests (embedded within the page), but not in cases where app navigation will trigger an import not initially served.
'ws' mode will become the default mode in the next major devServer version. This mode uses ws as a server, and native WebSockets on the client.
(assets) => {} - Run this specified callback against assets added later by plugins.

(lines only) - Source Maps are simplified to a single mapping per line. This usually means a single mapping per statement (assuming you author is this way). This prevents you from debugging execution on statement level and from settings breakpoints on columns of a line. Combining with minimizing is not possible as minimizers usually only emit a single line.
trans-unit.target: (lines only) : los mapas de origen se simplifican a un solo mapa por línea. Por lo general, esto significa un único mapeo por declaración (suponiendo que su autor sea así). Esto le impide depurar la ejecución a nivel de instrucción y configurar puntos de interrupción en columnas de una línea. La combinación con minimización no es posible ya que los minimizadores generalmente solo emiten una sola línea.

trans-unit.source: (lines only) - Source Maps are simplified to a single mapping per line. This usually means a single mapping per statement (assuming you author it this way). This prevents you from debugging execution on statement level and from settings breakpoints on columns of a line. Combining with minimizing is not possible as minimizers usually only emit a single line.
(none) (Omit the devtool option) - No SourceMap is emitted. This is a good option to start with.
trans-unit.target: (none) (Omita la opción devtool ) - No se emite ningún SourceMap. Esta es una buena opción para empezar.

trans-unit.source: Object with different parameter names
OverridablesPlugin (low level)
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_ADDITIONAL - Add additional assets to the compilation.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_ADDITIONS - Add additional sections to the existing assets e.g. banner or initialization code.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_ANALYSE - Analyze the existing assets.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_DERIVED - Derive new assets from the existing assets.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_DEV_TOOLING - Add development tooling to the assets, e.g. by extracting a source map.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_OPTIMIZE - Optimize existing assets in a general way.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_OPTIMIZE_COMPATIBILITY - Optimize the compatibility of existing assets, e.g. add polyfills or vendor prefixes.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_OPTIMIZE_COUNT - Optimize the count of existing assets, e.g. by merging them.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_OPTIMIZE_HASH - Optimize the hashes of the assets, e.g. by generating real hashes of the asset content.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_OPTIMIZE_INLINE5.8.0+ - Optimize the numbers of existing assets, e.g. by inlining assets into other assets.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_OPTIMIZE_SIZE - Optimize the size of existing assets, e.g. by minimizing or omitting whitespace.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_OPTIMIZE_TRANSFER - Optimize the transfer of existing assets, e.g. by preparing a compressed (gzip) file as separate asset.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_PRE_PROCESS - Basic preprocessing of the assets.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_REPORT - Creating assets for the reporting purposes.
PROCESS_ASSETS_STAGE_SUMMARIZE - Summarize the list of existing assets.

trans-unit.source: Rule.type sets the type for a matching module. This prevents defaultRules and their default importing behaviors from occurring. For example, if you want to load a .json file through a custom loader, you'd need to set the type to javascript/auto to bypass webpack's built-in json importing. (See v4.0 changelog for more details)
Rule.use can also be a function which receives the object argument describing the module being loaded, and must return an array of UseEntry items.
Rule.use can be an array of UseEntry which are applied to modules. Each entry specifies a loader to be used.

trans-unit.source: [named Foo FooA Bar] - generates import { FooA as Bar } from "Foo";.
[named Foo FooA] - generates export { Foo as FooA };.
[named Foo FooA] - generates import { FooA } from "Foo";.
[named Foo] - generates export { Foo };.

[named [name] [name]Alias] - generates ES module named exports and exports a value equal to the filename under other name., for single.js it will be single and singleAlias, generates export { single as singleAlias };.
[namespace Foo FooA] - generates import * as FooA from "Foo";.
[path] is replaced with the directories to the original asset, included trailing / (assets/images/).
[pure Foo] - generates require("Foo");.
[query] is replaced with the query of the original asset, included ? (?foo=bar).
[side-effects Foo] - generates import "Foo";.
[single ./my-lib Foo] - generates const Foo = require("./my-lib");.
[single Foo] - generates const Foo = require("Foo");.
[single Foo] - generates module.exports = Foo;.
[string] values are supported since webpack 5.

trans-unit.source: cacheCompression: Default true. When set, each Babel transform output will be compressed with Gzip. If you want to opt-out of cache compression, set it to false -- your project may benefit from this if it transpiles thousands of files.

cacheDirectory: Default false. When set, the given directory will be used to cache the results of the loader. Future webpack builds will attempt to read from the cache to avoid needing to run the potentially expensive Babel recompilation process on each run. If the value is blank (loader: 'babel-loader?cacheDirectory') or true (loader: babel-loader?cacheDirectory=true) the loader will use the default cache directory in node_modules/.cache/babel-loader or fallback to the default OS temporary file directory if no node_modules folder could be found in any root directory.
trans-unit.target: cacheDirectory : por defecto false . Cuando se establece, el directorio dado se utilizará para almacenar en caché los resultados del cargador. Las futuras compilaciones de paquetes web intentarán leer desde la caché para evitar tener que ejecutar el proceso de recompilación de Babel potencialmente costoso en cada ejecución. Si el valor está en blanco ( loader: 'babel-loader?cacheDirectory' ) o true ( loader: babel-loader?cacheDirectory=true ), el cargador usará el directorio de caché predeterminado en node_modules/.cache/babel-loader o volverá al directorio de archivos temporales del sistema operativo predeterminado si no se puede encontrar ninguna carpeta node_modules en ningún directorio raíz.

trans-unit.source: cacheDirectory: Default false. When set, the given directory will be used to cache the results of the loader. Future webpack builds will attempt to read from the cache to avoid needing to run the potentially expensive Babel recompilation process on each run. If the value is set to true in options ({cacheDirectory: true}), the loader will use the default cache directory in node_modules/.cache/babel-loader or fallback to the default OS temporary file directory if no node_modules folder could be found in any root directory.

This can be set to a custom value to force cache busting if the identifier changes.

trans-unit.source: cheap-eval-source-map - Similar to eval-source-map, each module is executed with eval(). It is "cheap" because it doesn't have column mappings, it only maps line numbers. It ignores SourceMaps from Loaders and only display transpiled code similar to the eval devtool.

trans-unit.source: cheap-module-eval-source-map - Similar to cheap-eval-source-map, however, in this case Source Maps from Loaders are processed for better results. However Loader Source Maps are simplified to a single mapping per line.
trans-unit.target: cheap-module-eval-source-map : similar a cheap-eval-source-map , sin embargo, en este caso, los mapas de origen de los cargadores se procesan para obtener mejores resultados. Sin embargo, los mapas de origen del cargador se simplifican a un único mapa por línea.

trans-unit.source: cheap-module-source-map - A SourceMap without column-mappings that simplifies loader Source Maps to a single mapping per line.

trans-unit.source: eval-* addition

eval-cheap-module-source-map - Similar to eval-cheap-source-map, however, in this case Source Maps from Loaders are processed for better results. However Loader Source Maps are simplified to a single mapping per line.

eval-cheap-source-map - Similar to eval-source-map, each module is executed with eval(). It is "cheap" because it doesn't have column mappings, it only maps line numbers. It ignores SourceMaps from Loaders and only display transpiled code similar to the eval devtool.

eval-source-map - Each module is executed with eval() and a SourceMap is added as a DataUrl to the eval(). Initially it is slow, but it provides fast rebuild speed and yields real files. Line numbers are correctly mapped since it gets mapped to the original code. It yields the best quality SourceMaps for development.
trans-unit.target: eval-source-map : cada módulo se ejecuta con eval() y se agrega un SourceMap como DataUrl a eval() . Inicialmente es lento, pero proporciona una velocidad de reconstrucción rápida y produce archivos reales. Los números de línea se asignan correctamente ya que se asignan al código original. Produce SourceMaps de la mejor calidad para el desarrollo.

trans-unit.source: eval - Each module is executed with eval() and //@ sourceURL. This is pretty fast. The main disadvantage is that it doesn't display line numbers correctly since it gets mapped to transpiled code instead of the original code (No Source Maps from Loaders).
trans-unit.target: eval : cada módulo se ejecuta con eval() y //@ sourceURL . Esto es bastante rápido. La principal desventaja es que no muestra los números de línea correctamente, ya que se asigna al código transpilado en lugar del código original (Sin mapas de origen de los cargadores).

trans-unit.source: eval wraps modules in eval("string") and the minimizer does not handle strings.
exclude (stringRegExp[string, RegExp]): Exclude modules that match the given value from source map generation.

exclude (string|regex|array): Exclude modules that match the given value from source map generation.
trans-unit.target: exclude ( string|regex|array ): excluye los módulos que coinciden con el valor dado de la generación del mapa fuente.

trans-unit.target: exclude : archivos para exclude . Predeterminado: undefined

trans-unit.source: optimization.innerGraph tells webpack whether to conduct inner graph analysis for unused exports.
optimization.mangleExports allows to control export mangling.
optimization.portableRecords tells webpack to generate records with relative paths to be able to move the context folder.

optimization.removeAvailableModules reduces the performance of webpack, and will be disabled in production mode by default in next major release. Disable it in production mode if you want extra build performance.

optimization.sideEffects depends on optimization.providedExports to be enabled. This dependency has a build time cost, but eliminating modules has positive impact on performance because of less code generation. Effect of this optimization depends on your codebase, try it for possible performance wins.
trans-unit.target: optimization.sideEffects depende de que optimization.providedExports esté habilitado. Esta dependencia tiene un costo de tiempo de construcción, pero la eliminación de módulos tiene un impacto positivo en el rendimiento debido a la menor generación de código. El efecto de esta optimización depende de su código base, pruébelo para posibles ganancias de rendimiento.

trans-unit.source: optimization.sideEffects depends on optimization.providedExports to be enabled. optimization.sideEffects will also flag modules as side effect free when they contain only side effect free statements.

trans-unit.source: require.resolveWeak is the foundation of universal rendering (SSR + Code Splitting), as used in packages such as react-universal-component. It allows code to render synchronously on both the server and initial page-loads on the client. It requires that chunks are manually served or somehow available. It's able to require modules without indicating they should be bundled into a chunk. It's used in conjunction with import() which takes over when user navigation triggers additional imports.
trans-unit.target: require.resolveWeak es la base de la representación universal (SSR + División de código), como se usa en paquetes como react-universal-component . Permite que el código se procese sincrónicamente tanto en el servidor como en las cargas de página iniciales en el cliente. Requiere que los trozos se sirvan manualmente o estén disponibles de alguna manera. Puede requerir módulos sin indicar que deben agruparse en un fragmento. Se usa junto con import() que se hace cargo cuando la navegación del usuario activa importaciones adicionales.

trans-unit.source: splitChunks.minRemainingSize only takes effect when a single chunk is remaining.

splitChunks.minRemainingSize option was introduced in webpack 5 to avoid zero sized modules by ensuring that the minimum size of the chunk which remains after splitting is above a limit. Defaults to 0 in 'development' mode. For other cases splitChunks.minRemainingSize defaults to the value of splitChunks.minSize so it doesn't need to be specified manually except for the rare cases where deep control is required.
